Reviews.Title: “An era Hotel at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: echobella
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Fenice et des Artistes is a little gem at the heart of Venice, taking its inpiration from the golden theatrical era of Venezia. All of its rooms are heavÄ±ly decorated with guilds and embroidery , overlooking a lovely canal where sometimes you will hear and see gondola serenades. It is also located on a side little plaza so you will be away from all the hustle and bustle and yet stay close to the center which is only 5 minutes walk. The bathrooms are on the small scale so be sure to ask a room that has a big bath.

Reviews.Title: “A real "find" in Venice”
Reviews.Author: poipu67
Reviews.Content: La Fenice is well located and near to La Fenice Opera House. It is charming in all respects. We had a delightful stay enhanced by friendly and very helpful staff. The rooms are good sized and everything was immaculate. The location is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint , perfect location”
Reviews.Author: margauxhanoi
Reviews.Content: We went there 15 years ago, wanted to have a cheap week end in Venice so went again. It is perfect as we were going to the opera which is next door. Obviously, the hotel needs refreshing BUT the rooms are clean, quite large and perfectly adequate for a week end. the location is grand, a bit more in the town so you feel like you are in the more "real" Venice than staying right next to San Marco. the staff is very friendly. Breakfast is nothing special; but fine. Good value for money (do not expect modern, trendy!)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & quaint, and qualified staff”
Reviews.Author: MGD54
Reviews.Content: A fine and quiet Venice location, adjacent to the Opera House and only steps away from major sites and vaporetto's. The hotel has not much changed in the last twenty years and the amenities are all right. A good ratio quality/price for Venice, especially the spaciousness of the rooms and bathroom, with friendly and competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: seajrw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Room and bathroom were clean. We got a room that was a little cheaper than a double because it had two single beds pushed together, and you could barely tell it was two beds instead of one. There was a nice wardrobe to hang our clothes, and it locked. There is internet access-- 2 euros for 24 hours worth of internet. Not the fastest internet but certainly adequate for checking email, etc. Slow if you are uploading pictures from a camera or trying to watch a video. It was fairly quiet except for New Year's eve, which is understandable (there was a lot of noise coming from the restaurant that is attached to the hotel). No more than a few minutes away from St. Mark's Square; can't beat the location if you want to be that close. All of the concierges except for one were very friendly and helpful. The best part was the continental breakfast, which includes toast, croissants, cereal, plain and sweetened yogurt, jam, honey and Nutella, tea, juice, and there's a cappuccino maker as well. It lasts from 7:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. and is constantly being replenished. There's a large and comfortable dining area to eat. We had a great stay here and would recommend it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: patricia b
Reviews.Content: We made a terrible mistake. The relais and chateau hotel we were meant to stay in was booked so we listened to the concierges recommendation. thus, La Fenice. The first room we were in had drilling front he street so loud we couldn't stand it and walls were shaking. They moved us to another room that had a closet..yup! First one didn't. The hotel was so strangely located that we were lost every day and also at night worse as we were a bit afraid walking the dark streets. Friends had asked us where we were staying in Venice and I thought that was annoying. Now I know why! You need to stay in a good hotel in Venice! Everything is terribly expensive in the city to begin with but so happy to have finally visited the city! We even had to pay for a small bottle of water. We left after two nights and went to Florence and stayed at a fabulous relais and chateau hotel that was less than the dump in Venice(hotel in Florence called Relais Santa Croce). I was miserable in the hotel and wouldn't walk on floors without shoes......my advise is to save up and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: sylik_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 9 hotels which were all 3 stars across Europe. This review is based on the fact it is a 3 star hotel. Pros: The biggest shower of any of the hotels we stayed in. Bathroom was good. Room was clean and spacious. The air conditioner worked well. The Staff were very friendly and helpful, all spoke english well enough. Free wifi for 15minutes every day, or 2 euro for 24hours. Great location in Venice as many great eateries and San Marco Piazza are all just around the corner. Buffet breakfast was as good as any of the other 3 star hotels we stayed at. Cons: Finding the hotel could be a bit tricky, however finding anything in Venice is tricky until you've been there before. Had to take the steps up to the first floor where the elevator begins, however staff helped us with our luggage. If you were disabled, Venice is full of stairs anyway, so the stairs to the elevator were not an issue. Our first night we noticed some mosquito's in our room, i think the previous guests whom checked out had left the windows open all morning. This hotel was fantastic, it met all of our needs during our time in Venice. We wouldn't have a problem going back there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PABrit
Reviews.Content: This long-established hotel is good value for money; comfortable, quiet, only a few minutes' walk from the city centre and situated in a peaceful little square. It is very near vaporettos, San Marco, the Rialto bridge, restaurants and so on. Our first room was small and dark, with a filthy carpet and a bathroom designed for midgets. When I protested the staff were very obliging and friendly about finding us a much nicer room with a pleasant view. The receptionists were also very helpful about booking our journey to the airport, finding other restaurants and so on. The breakfast is excellent and very much better than many Italian hotels. We would have liked muesli as well but that is a small quibble considering how delicious it all was, especially the yogurt. The restaurant is wonderful - as it has been for many decades. We were on vacation so were not bothered about the internet or television but both seemed perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: viabrera
Reviews.Content: A little hard to find, but conveniently located in a nice small quite square just a few minutes walk from San Marco Square. Staff was friendly and very helpful. I had a single room wich was very small but clean and adequate. It had a great view out the window of a nice courtyard and a small canal. The included breakfast was very basic, but you can order things like eggs, fried meat and yogurt for an extra charge. I was not able to access the Internet from my room, but had no problem while sitting in the lobby. There was a charge of 2 euro for 24 hours for Internet. TV had lots of stations but only BBC and CNN in english. There is an attached restaurant which I didn't try but seemed to be crowded every night. There was nothing about this hotel that really wow'd me (except the location) but also no complaints. For the price this seemed to be a great value considering the location and how much more other similar hotels cost.

Reviews.Title: “I'd like to come back”
Reviews.Author: ElenaKir
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel is a good value for the money. The website gives a good hint on how to get there - it helped me a lot. The hotel is located in the center of everything (3 minutes walk from San Marco square) and at the same time it's not noisy. The breakfast was very basic, but ok. The room is clean, well equipped. No mosquitos, by the way. Or maybe I was just lucky. Fair air-conditioning. Staff is very helpful, nice and multi-lingual. I'm very satisfied with my stay there and should I return to Venice, I'd like to stay in this hotel. If you ask me, I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful decor,”
Reviews.Author: Anjparekh
Reviews.Content: Would totally recommend this hotel. We spent our honeymoon here. Was upgraded as soon as I mentioned this. Located in San Marco which is the best place to be, next to the opera house. Room had AC.Breakfast was a typical continental but was just ok. Staff were friendly and helpful, little italian lady added to the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but spartan.”
Reviews.Author: Julie2115
Reviews.Content: Great location in Venice, but our room was very basic. The bathroom was newer and very clean. Air conditioning was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; if not a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: GELJ
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was a clear plus; easy to get to San Marco and in a relatively quite, but cultured part of the city. However, what other people have commented on as quaint we found a little dated. The communal areas are fine, they're spacious and comfortable but the room themselves were a little dingy and dark, the fittings aged and worn and the layout just a little bit, well, strange. Nevertheless, ours was a comfortable stay and we found the staff to be helpful and polite, whilst the breakfast, though simple and continental was fine - though charging for a hot breakfast seemed a little stingy!

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel. It's fine.”
Reviews.Author: Eilisd
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed in this hotel, not in 2011, but in February 2009. I selected it on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews, and also because of the interesting name. It's a smallish hotel, close to the theatre La Fenice, and is supposed to be popular with singers and actors. The rooms are very nicely decorated: theatrical scenes are painted on the walls, and they use dramatic chandeliers, made of Murano glass, for lighting. The situation is very central - a short stroll from St Mark's Square etc. It's a small, friendly, pretty basic sort of hotel, but with character, some nice touches, and in a great location. Good value for money, close to everything. February was a very good month to visit. We had excellent weather, Venice was not crowded. And it is one of the most beautiful, fairytale, cities on the planet. Everyone should go there at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: CmanScrufy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find. From the train station it took a 25 min water bus ride and a 10 min walk through thin alleys and over cobblestones, definitely better to walk and not take the expensive water taxi. We arrived before the normal check in time but the room was ready and we were helped with our bags up to our room. There is an elevator on site but you still have to go up a flight of stairs to get to it, not a problem though. The receptionist was very friendly. She gave us a map and directions to all the major sites and recommended restaurants too. She was also a great help when we needed something translated from Italian to English. The room was large with antique furniture and Murano glass chandeliers. There was some mold in the shower and the air conditioning worked well but could not get rid of the humidity. Most of the time it felt sticky in the room and I could notice the stickiness on my flip flops when I went to put them on. There is WiFi but you cannot access it in the rooms. It is free for the first 15 min of each day and then 2 Euros for 24 hours. It was very quiet at night. There are no cars or mopeds in Venice. The stay was enjoyable, the service friendly and the location was out of the way but not too far from any of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very helpful and great location.”
Reviews.Author: malagamolly
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this trip as a surprise for my birthday. We stayed at the hotel for four nights and had the most amazing time. The staff were so helpful and even upgraded our room as it was for a special occasion to a room with a huge roof terrace. We would sit and have a night cap and listen to the church bells and the odd opera singer on one of the many gondolas that passed beneath us. Take good walking shoes as you will certainly earn your dinner!! The breakfast has been quoted in other reviews as poor quality but we found the breakfast was more than adequate to start the day. The croissants filled with custard cream filling were amazing. The highlight of our trip was a night at the opera to se La Traviata. This certainly is the most romatic place we have been, more so than Paris!!! I will definately be returning to this quaint romantic hotel again and can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for quality”
Reviews.Author: Jth1980
Reviews.Content: Staff not friendly. Asked not to go in room and put up do not disturb sign and staff went into room anyway. Old rooms, broken toilet seat. Pay more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: TravelLuvR_81
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this hotel is the location is great. Very central to San Marco's square. From the time we arrived, it was down hill. We paid the equivalent of $300 a night to stay here & it was a dump. The lobby seemed charming, but as soon as we went up the elevator to our floor, the first thing you see is a very strange & creepy S&M painting. We open to doors to our rooms which were supposed to be double rooms. Imagine how surprised I was when we see 2 twin sized mattresses pushed together. Lets not forget the wall to wall upholstery with holes in the wood work that looked like rats had been there. So after we got over the shock of this looking like a murder mystery hotel, we went out to dinner. They ask you to leave your only room key behind so they will know if you're in or not-I've never been asked to do this anywhere else so it made me feel very uncomfortable. The next day, we had to ask for a key to the safe in the room, which the safe was about the size of a child's shoe box. We could barely fit our 2 passports & 1 wallet in there much less anything else. So, we saw the chamber maid in the hall way & asked her for 2 clean towels & let her know that we did not need our room cleaned that day. We also put the sign on the door that say "Please do not disturb" so she wouldn't go in. We ventured out for a while & came back to find that the maid had been in our room after we'd asked her not to go in & put the sign on the door. Everything had been moved & when we went down to the front desk to ask why that would happen, not only did we speak to the 2 workers, but we also spoke with the manager. Not one of them ever apologize for this but they just couldn't understand why we would be upset when we specifically asked for our rooms not to be entered our privacy wasn't respected. The manager kept saying "I will have to ask the maid when she comes in tomorrow, I don't know why she would have gone in. You just have to trust us." I said to her that it's hard to trust a place that you ask & put a sign up to not enter into our space & they clearly don't respect our wishes. That same morning at breakfast the waiter was very rude to us on more than one occasion. Venice was our last leg of our trip following Rome & Florence. The breakfast was the worst at La Fenice de Artistes & the customer service was atrocious! I would much rather have spent my $300 a night to stay in a nicer place somewhere else where they respect the customers. I've never had such poor customer service in the US anywhere I've ever stayed. It was very disappointing to have such a terrible hotel experience in a very charming & romantic city. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel which is charming â€“ but hot water is inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: GSTgst
Reviews.Content: Good- â€¢ Hotel has lots of charm. â€¢ Breakfast was great â€“ and has unlimited coffee/cappuccino/espresso â€¢ Location was central, but in a nice quite area. â€¢ Our room was classic Venetian â€“ red and gold Dansk (wallpaper). Perfect ambiance for a stay in Venice. â€¢ Staff all spoke good English. â€¢ Lot of seating area, both inside and outside on a patio. â€¢ Our room was on a canal was we were pleasantly serenaded by gondola riders, but it wasnâ€™t too much. â€¢ WI-FI was good. Be sure to buy the 2 Euro/day â€œpassâ€�, and not the hourly codes (which are good for the computer in the public area). â€¢ Because a quirk in timing, I had to store a large suitcase at the hotel for a week before I checked it. They graciously accepted the bag at no cost. â€¢ A/C was good, although it leaked all over the carpet the first night. Bad- â€¢ Lots of mosquitoes in the area (but thatâ€™s typical of all Venice I understand). â€¢ Itâ€™s a nightmare getting to the hotel. (but Venice is a labyrinth, so this is typical). â€¢ Hot water was inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “A gem outside of St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: jpz319
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Fenice is a perfect hotel for a long weekend trip with your spouse. The hotel is conveniently located outside of St. Mark's Square. It is pleasantly located away from the hustle and bustle. It is very, very clean with charming and unique rooms. The standard room is very large with a large bathroom as well. A decent breakfast is included in the standard room rates. I would not rate this hotel "excellent" due to the busy hotel staff. Yes, the staff helped you get from one place to the next and even made a dinner reservation for us as well. However, there is a difference between receiving rushed answers/recommendations and thoughtful/sincere recommendations. The front desk seemed overwhelmingly busy for the long 4th of July weekend. This did not hinder our trip due to the extensive tripadvisor research in advance. We were ready with our attractions, dining, and itinerary, etc for the long weekend (3nights/4days) in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: cl_and_cd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is quite nice albeit a little tired, but to be fair they were in the process of renovating when we were there so it should get better. The thing that really disappointed us was the attitude of the staff. Would it kill them to smile occasionally?

Reviews.Title: “venetian charm and courtesy”
Reviews.Author: peter188108
Reviews.Content: If you like your hotels to have homogeneous rooms, the showroom plastic look, then La Fenice et des Artistes is not for you. The rooms have individual charm and, even if a little tired in places, they have a great deal of character and it would be a pity to try to modernise everything. The whole hotel is hung with pictures, paintings and theatre memorabilia which create a rather special feel. We stayed four nights and believe the hotel offered good value for money, especially as it is so well placed for St. Mark's Square (five minutes away), the Rialto bridge in the other direction and the Accademia. The staff of the hotel were really obliging, friendly and helpful and ensured that our stay, to celebrate a sixtieth birthday, was memorable. All in all, it is a hotel that we have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Great position but hotel was rather tired”
Reviews.Author: Lise_D2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet location, very near La Fenice, and therefore very central for all the sights - with St Mark's Square 5 minutes walk away. The room we were allocated was like an attic room, with twin beds and a ensuite bathroom. Our bathroom had a bath with shower attachment - however, there was barely any water pressure and the water was lukewarm. When we complained, it was improved, but the amount of hot water was enough for half a bath only. The breakfast was mediocre - the coffee was undrinkable, there was cornflakes, juice, sweet buns, bread rolls, cheese and ham, yoghurt, but no fresh fruit. In all I do not think this hotel merited 4 stars - more like 3.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Canals”
Reviews.Author: betshean
Reviews.Content: Place is like a maze -really hard to follow an A-Z, but was very beautiful with the Gondolas all around. Gondola rides about 80 euros a boat-but if you share with 3 or 4 its a better deal -definitely worth a ride. Boats that take you around the canal are really frequent and a lovely way to see the city A friendly atmosphere with often musicians playing in the squares and a lively time at night.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious Service”
Reviews.Author: lastingpeace
Reviews.Content: I won't recommend this hotel to anyone. We paid upfront for a room while we were still in Canada, but the clerk tried to make us pay again when we were checking out. They put us in a room at the back with a broken air conditioner and two very narrow beds. When I objected, they put us in another terrible room. So finally on the second night we finally had a much bigger room with a nice large bath. The computer was often out of order and no one went out of their way to get it fixed. The staff were constantly making excuses and not being helpful. We purchased tickets for a tour from the hotel and couldn't find the tour group.

Reviews.Title: “MIXED FEELINGS”
Reviews.Author: aalliicciiaa17
Reviews.Content: We had arrived to the airport in Venice from Paris and had come across a desk there that books hotels. We started chatting with the lady and she could find some deals and then you end up paying her $4.00 to use her services (not bad as we didn't book any hotels on our trip). She had mentioned the hotel was a 4* and was 90EUR/night with breakfast and we accepted. The hotel was a typical venetian hotel but I was expecting it to be a little more nicer considering it was a 4*-but the European standards are different from other places. Not a big deal I got over the red pattern walls with a matching bedspread. They ask you if you want a shower or tub-not both. We asked for a shower and it was small and outdated. the TV was super small, maybe 2 english channels, once again not a big deal. You get 15 minutes freee of internet time on their computer so that was a bonus and the waitor is super nice. For breakfast, it was standard filled crossiants, bread, buns, tea, coffee, cappachinos, fruit and juice. You could pay extra for bacon and eggs and other breakfasts. Overall, this is a good hotel as long as you don't care about what the room looks like too much.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, nice location but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Rictest
Reviews.Content: We've spent 3 nights at this hotel, the location is central, short distance to everything in San Marco, the room decoration is beautiful, venetian style. The bathroom was small and I had to make some contorsion to use the toilet. Overall very pleasant with kind people but overpriced for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Btrtrvl
Reviews.Content: Though not modern and sparkly, this hotel was a perfect fit for our nights in Venice. We actually did not spend much time in the room because of exploring the city every day. Our room was overlooking the courtyard. We had a lot of space. It was very clean. The location was central. The breakfast was European with cheeses, meats and breads. Fine for us. What made this place excellent was the staff. Given umbrellas to borrow on a rainy day, good dining recommendations, questions always answered with a smile, and the desk attendant walked us to our water taxi on our check out day. That was wonderful as we had been lost so many times. Old world feel and nice hospitality. Oops... Mosquitos when we were there. DO not leave your window open. You will be sorry. Thank you Hotel Fenice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: teacher314
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights; a friend recommended this hotel to us. It was in a good location - close to everything, but in a quiet square so there wasn't much street noise most of the time. We had very loud upstairs neighbors our second night, but a pair of earplugs solved that problem for me! The room was quite charming - a good size, a lot of storage room, etc. Our room had an unusual smell - we think it was the comforter, as the smell was gone after housekeeping came the second day. The bathroom was immaculate and a nice size. Our shower sprayer (the kind on a flexible hose that can be adjusted for height) did not stay in place and kept twisting around and sliding down, so I had to hold it up while I showered! The staff was very helpful and spoke pretty good English. Breakfast was pretty sparse and was so busy on our second morning that we ended up eating in the lounge next to the breakfast room. We would have liked to have seen more food set out, but maybe this is typical of Venetian hotels. There is no free wifi here; each guest is allowed 15 free minutes at the one computer in the lounge. Overall, we liked this hotel but it had a few quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and excellent staff help make this a great hotel for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: gino71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a romantic getaway in Venice. We couldn't have asked for a more traditionally Venetian hotel - the hotel is tucked away from the general bustle of Piazza San Marco yet within a 5 minute stroll of the main square or the Rialto in the opposite direction. The staff were very helpful and friendly and more than made up for my broken Italian with their excellent English. We were very lucky to have got a room with a balcony overlooking one of the small canals where Gondolas passed by all day although I don't think there are many of these rooms in total. Breakfast was a simple cold continental buffet but ample to start you off ready for a day wandering around Venice. The hotel has an evening restaurant attached, but it was very expensive so we ate at other restaurants which the receptionist recommended, all of which were excellent. It's easy to get to either by foot or our preference by using the ATVO waterbus' (only six euros or 18 for a day pass) from the station stopping at either Giglio or San Marco itself. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a romantic night or 2 and well worth dropping them an email in advance to ask for a room over the canal if they have one.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet spot”
Reviews.Author: Greg0rys
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a nice quiet side street. Close to St Marks Square, short walk to Rialto Bridge and Grande Canal. Claudio and other staff very helpful, great with ordering up tours and water taxis. Breakfast buffet could use a few more items. Rooms older but very clean and quaint. Rooms backed onto a small canal that was part of the gondola route, so we got some free opera as they went past. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff,quaint,excellant location,lovely large room overlooking the canal”
Reviews.Author: gracekelly94610
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a gem hidden away from the heavily populated areas but easily reached and within comfortable walking distance of St. Mark's Square. The staff was more than accommodating to the extent that one of the front desk persons( a gentleman) actually left his post to walk us to the restaurant he had suggested for dinner! It was delicious by the way! Staff made reservations for our water taxis and a night at the Opera in an old palace...what a treat. We stayed for four nights, left for a seven day cruise, then returned for one night before returning to the San Francisco area.Jada at the Front desk made us feel very welcome and taken care of. The porter carried our many(too many) suitcases to meet the water taxi twice with a smile on his face despite the heavy load and stayed with us until we had safely boarded and were on our way. I will return to Venice and I can't wait to return to La Fenice des Artistes...........a grateful guest

Reviews.Title: “Please please ignore the bad reviews about this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gracebrown
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a birthday present and when we read the reviews about it we almost cancelled but what a mistake that would have been. We spent 2 nights here and loved every minute of our stay. The hotel is in a quiet square next to the Opera House in Venice. It is in a perfect spot to escape the crowds. The rooms and public areas are covered in interesting art works and there is even an accompanying brochure which explains them all. We were given a large room at the front of the hotel over the square and bar below. The room was almost like a suite with a seperate sitting area. Yes some of the decoration and furniture is dated but that is part of the hotel's charm. The room was clean and bright and we loved going back to it after long days taking in the sights of Venice. After a show one night we opened the windows to hear opera singers singing in the bar below and it was wonderful. Staff were courteous,helpful and efficient. Absolutely no complaints and if we ever returned to Venice this is where we would want to stay. Please do not be put off by poor reviews about this hotel. If you want modern, functional and boring then this is not the hotel for you but if you want an interesting piece of venice history and quality service you will love it like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter_za
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Quick to get to san marco square and easy to find on arrival. The room was well sized and clean. The hotel is a bit old, old antique furniture with venetian lights. Bathroom was small but adequate. Hotel provided a continental breakfast, juice, cereal, croissants. Has a lovely little courtyard where you can relax at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves only 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: 54austin
Reviews.Content: Apparently, many hotels in Italy hurriedly added hair dryers and a tv to their rooms before the jubilee in order to go from 3 to 4 stars. This one looks like they did. For the money and stars, the rooms should be cleaner and less worn, amenities be better, breakfast be more ample and staff more friendly. The location is good, but Venice is so compact (and packed with hotels), that you could find something else as good. If you have the time and disposition, you could even walk around and find a place with a vacancy. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: katehSheffield
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a good location: just a few minutes from all the major spots and easy to reach from the water bus stops. Our group had two single rooms and a twin room, each of which was well appointed, traditionally decorated (but NOT shabby) and clean. The twin room was on the top floor and with sloping ceilings and a very high window, so there was no view from the room - but then we didn't go to Venice to look out of a window! Views from the other rooms were lovely. One of the rooms didn't have a shower, but did have a bath. All in all the rooms were fine. Breakfast was also good: a buffet with bread, cheese, meat, fruit, cereal, yoghurts and as much coffee / tea / juice as you wanted. Do be careful of mosquitoes - we didn't leave our windows open, but still managed to play host and I have the scars to prove it! The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a very pleasant lounge and a lovely little courtyard. I guess the hotel might seem expensive for what it is - it isn't fabulously luxurious, but it's comfy, clean and friendly - and remember Venice IS expensive. When arriving the easiest bus stop to reach the hotel from is San Angelo - just follow the instructions on the hotel website and you can't go wrong. This route includes just two bridges and is a much quieter route than approaching from San Marco - so it's easier to manage with suitcases. To reach San Angelo you will need the Alilaguna 'A' line from the airport: tickets can be bought in the airport for 13e each. Useful websites: www.hellovenezia.com www.actv.it (these are both offical sites for the two bus companies) http://europeforvisitors.com/venice/ (this appears to be an independent site and amongst lots of other useful information gives step by step instructions for getting from the airport and using the public transport system)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel well situated.”
Reviews.Author: patarn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely holiday in Venice. We liked this hotel. Its location was in a fairly quiet part of the city but an easy walk to the main sights. Venice itself is easy to negotiate so anywhere in San Marco is handy. Good restaurants close, but like all Venice, not cheap! The staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was what you would expect for continental. There are two pleasant garden areas which are nice to sit in and have a drink at the end of the day. The rooms were good sized for Italy, showers good but took a while to warm up and the air con was good after we had fiddled with the control. I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WarrenVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed as this hotel between August 31st and September 4th. We paid $150 euros per night and I am sure that we could have gotten a much better hotel for the same money. The hotel is rated as a four star, but in reality it is at best a 2.5 star. In particular: The breakfast was poor. The front desk staff was surely. When someone complained about their room, the clerk told her that she should leave. You are given 30 complimentary minutes of internet access a day. However, there is only one computer and it doesn't work very well. The room we had was must and there were bugs. In the evening and in the morning there was quite a bit of noise There were no English language television channels. Granted you don't visit Venice to wath television. However, a bit of CNN International or BBC at night would have been nice. When someone complained about this, the front desk clerk replied that "this isn't England".

Reviews.Title: “Very good room, pleasant staff, good and charming location.”
Reviews.Author: Venetianvisitor
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a superior double because it was a special occasion which we mentioned by email after booking but before arrival and was taken note of. We were given a very pleasant welcome. The room was very good, with a v large & comfortable double bed, tasteful pale green decor, good cupboard space and a safe. 4 large casement windows with shutters opened over looking the small square. The room could divide into 2 with attractive painted sliding doors so there was a sitting room area with a comfortable leather sofa, coffee table etc which was very nice after a long day walking. Very effective air conditioning and reasonable bathroom with bath and shower above (could do with a new shower curtain). Basic (not luxury) toiletries provided and replenished and good sized towels and one of those on the wall hairdriers. English language news stations on TV. Minibar curiously contained water, and one each of fanta, coke and beer (never 2 beers say or 2 cokes) no wine or snacks. No coffee/tea making facilities or notepaper, pens. Nice original art work on the walls. Staff such as we saw of them were good, receptionist and waiter very efficient and very friendly. Breakfast average for Italy, you pay extra for eggs etc but yoghurt, cereal, bread rolls, cheese, jams, ham limited fruit etc available. However one day when we slept in late and did "do not disturb" our room was done late but towels not replaced, notifying reception didn't change this, but we didn't pursue it as it didn't bother us too much and they were replaced the next day. Room service was available for drinks but we didn't make use of it as we went out. Lift was only from 1st floor level, didn't bother us but might others, porterage was offered but we didn't need it. In the other wing I think there was a lift from ground floor. Public areas pleasant and comfortable but sofas in lounge areas could probably do with some updating before too long. Magazines and newspapers available in lounge but not a huge choice. . Charming little outside courtyard garden with seating areas off reception. Small bar which was available early evening by getting reception to call the waiter. Signed photos of lots of Italian singers and actors etc on wall in bar, including Pavarotti who presumably had stayed there. We knew the location already but it was very pleasant and convenient. San Angelo vaparetto from which also you can get straight to/from the airport by hourly Alilaguna 5 minutes walk away, same distance to Guglia. 10 mins or less walk to S Marco or Rialto or Accedemia depending on how many wrong turns you make. Three restaurants within 30 seconds walk of the hotel door although we generally went further afield. We heard strains of opera rehearsal from the Fenice when the windows were open one morning which was very charming.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, friendly and helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: flighty_9
Reviews.Content: get a guidebook and a good map, the one the hotel gave us was quite confusing. The DK eyewitness guide was very good. go to ca Rezonnico, amazing, and the academy turned out to be a great choice to go to first. go early that way you miss the crowds

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: overfiftyBristol
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late, after a delay from bristol,by water bus from the airport got los t almost immediately even though we had done some research we still managed to go the wrong way.A very kind man outside The Mercure hotel took us to La Fenice,our room was large and had air con and mosquito plug supplied,also very clean,we then dicovered no key for our suitcase padlock! In the morning hotel staff took our suitcase while they looked for some bolt cutters and were very helpfull. Our breakfast was fine and always plenty there,again staff were friendly.We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would certainly go back there again,it is in a quiet area but not far from everything.We walked and took the water bus everywhere stopping off where we wanted, it was very hot but small water bottles were only 1 euro away from st marks square.We brought hats and almost got carried away in Murano and brought a beautiful glass scultpure but came to our senses when we went for a coffee! You dont have to spend a fortune and it is better to save some of the tourist sights for another time as you dont want to spend all your time in endless queues. We loved everything about Venice including our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: reci
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel- I know Venice is expensive, but I thought it was too expensive for the quality- our shower did not have a curtain. The staff was aloof and seemed put out when we asked for help. I would recommend this hotel, but I would also say that it's not great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for the price of the stay”
Reviews.Author: Napey
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very easily from the San Marco vaporetto stop at night and were initally very worried when we arrived and an American guest was in reception (at 11.30 at night) complaining about the size of her room and that it was too hot. Our room was perfectly adequatly sized though, with a very clean bathroom (always a good sign!) and air conditioning. The tv was about as small as you could get, but we didnt go to Venice to watch TV!! The breakfast isnt anything to write home about, but we are not fans of the Continental Breakfast anyway, what was there was fresh and perfectly acceptable. I dont know what other 4 star hotels are like in Venice, but I would have said this was nearer a good 3 star. That said, it was much cheaper than the other 4 stars in the local area, so I suppose you get what you pay for! Personally, Venice is not a place we would go back to, nice place to visit once!! However, if we did, I wouldnt have any worries about going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but not 4stars quality”
Reviews.Author: Ellik111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the very center of Venice, you can walk to the main tourist attractions in no time. The receptionists very friendly and helpfull. We got a relatively large (large for Venetian standards) room with a nice large bathroom with a bathtub. Everything was nice, but it's not a 4-star quality as I know it. The room was quite old, the TV is small, the windows are small and so on. So, no luxury, but a fairly nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: VilePixie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my Mum in early May. It wasn't easy to find at night but its so close to the theatre that we kept asking and people were good enough to point us in the right direction. The first room we wasn't so good - very hot and they wouldn't put the aircon on, but the next morning they showed us two other rooms that were cooler and looked out onto a canal and a bridge. We had clean sheets every day and everywhere was spotless. We had a very modern and very large bathroom which was great. The room itself was a pretty reasonable size. Breakfast was pretty standard, with the usual ham, cheeses, fruit, yoghurt, breads, croissant etc but there was always plenty and it was fresh. Great location, only 5 minutes away from San Marco square but quieter and off the beaten track which was good. I'd go back to this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Travelledabit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel La Fenice for three nights and loved it. Its location is perfect and we walked absolutely everywhere except to arrive and depart. The St Angelo vaporetto stop is three minutes from the hotel down quaint alleys and we took the orange line to arrive there from the airport. Our room was lovely - clean, pristine with modern ensuite and decorated in Venetian style with glass chandelier andshuttered windows overlooking a tiny bridge and canal which was so picturesque - we could even hear and watch a passing gondola complete with singing gondolier and accordion. Beds were very comfortable and we slept very well beacuse the closed shutters made the room so dark. I asked for an extra blanket and got one immediately and the cappuccinos at the bar were excellent. Breakfast was standard Continental buffet fare which was enjoyably fresh and plentiful - best bit was real tea pots and boiling water to have a proper cup of tea! The central location saved us many euros on toilet visits ( 1.50 near St Mark's!) as we just came back to hotel for rest stop. The visitors' book is worth a look as famous performers stay at the hotel next to the theatre and there are photos of them in the bar too. All in all, a brilliant find and we would definitely stay again as it was superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kes2n_Girl
Reviews.Content: A comfortable stay in central Venice, within easy walking distance of many of the main sites, and not too far from the Grand Canal and vaporetto stops. We had a good-sized room for a Venetian hotel, with a modern bathroom. It all appeared to be clean and run efficiently. Helpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water for 3 days and told to "get out"”
Reviews.Author: coco060
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October and it spoiled our trip. The first evening I had a luke warm shower and my husband had a cold one. We reported this on our way out to dinner and asked that it be fixed while we were out. When we returned only the night receptionist was on duty and he denied the problem, but finally offered 2 other rooms, one inferior and the other also with no hot water. In the morning we had cold showers and then went to reception to complain. We were told that there was nothing wrong with the water and that it was 60 degrees. When we persisted, a man who may have been Basil Faulty, raged out of the back room screaming and finally told us to â€œget outâ€� â€“ twice. Of course our room was paid for so this was not an option. Other guests, hearing the abuse, also approached us and reported that they had the same problem. Before writing this review I gave the hotel chain the opportunity to explain and have finally received an answer. It was rude, aggressive and factually inaccurate. In fact it was written by someone, who as far as I know, was not even there when this took place, but disputes my report. Also, the breakfast was bad, the coffee was terrible and there was toilet paper stuffed in the bathroom window to stop it rattling.

Reviews.Title: “Invest in a Map”
Reviews.Author: paulinebell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Grandaughter. After a muddle of the room, which was quicly and efficiently sorted. We were moved to a room we maned the dolls house, as everything was miniture. However th Hotel itself was very central (once we found it!) and the staff most oblidging. We had the pop up map and suddenly realised that the streets were lined with people with all sorts of maps, non of which seemd to be of much use with all the side streets! It was a nice way to meet people however. Once we got our bearing, we realised that no-where was far from anywhere. Would we go bck to same Hotel? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Allocation”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolStella
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in the Hotel La Fenice et deas Artistes and want to thank all the staff there for making our visit so enjoyable. The hotel was ideally located and our room were very clean and confortable. We particularly appreciated the prompt responses to our email enquiries before we arrived and the efficient booking of the water taxi to take us to the airport. We would not hesitate to reccomend the hotel to anyone to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PoJo_85
Reviews.Content: Great hotel tucked away just round the corner from San Marco. Rooms are spacious with traditional venetian design, but can get quite hot which the air conditioning did not seem to resolve, but after turning down the radiator and leaving the window a jar throughout the day it seemed bearable. The breakfast in the morning provides a wonderful selection of yoghurt, cereal, juice, coffee, pastries, ham, cheese, jams, and every different variation of tea that you can imagine! The only warning I would give is that each room has a connecting door to the next room, and the walls seem very thin meaning you can hear a lot.... Other than that, this hotel provided a great base in a great location. I would recommend venturing over to Santa Croce for some wonderful food though, and if you are looking for a bit of a lively night, there is a square which we stumbled upon on that side of Rialto bridge where the market is during the day which was buzzing with the italian students drinking in the various bars which appear later on in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “La Fenice is a honey of a hotel !”
Reviews.Author: formerFA
Reviews.Content: Family and I find the Fenice a honey of a hotel. My husband, daughter, son-in-law, and I settled in for five sweet nights last April in two charming, comfortable, clean rooms. Kids' room had view of Santo Stefano belltower and rio de la Verona. Our room #356 had four windows, one to courtyard with lush cascading wisteria; one to garden below with exotic palm tree; the others out on to adjacent La Fenice Opera House and the small Campo de la Fenice---just around the corner from Campo San Fantin with its land entrance to the Opera House. We had two cozy double beds pushed together; plenty of clothes-hanging space in the large armoire; immaculate, modern bathroom; excellent breakfast each morning in the hotel's historic "La Taverna" restaurant, including the best cappucchino-molto-caldo in Venice. The amiable staff helped us with water taxi reservations, "La Zucca" dinner reservations (concierge Ileanna); another gave us a bonus tour of the hotel's rooftop apartment where Marcello Mastroianni (yes!) used to stay. (Alberto) One reason we booked here is that in the book "Italian Days" author Barbara Grizzuti Harrison describes it as her favorite in Venice because of its old-time character. We agree. Plus, we love staying in SAN MARCO, so sue us ! Grazie, La Fenice.

Reviews.Title: “Tired tired tired”
Reviews.Author: Durer
Reviews.Content: This is the third or fourth time in about ten years I have stayed here and, sadly, it will be the last time. All what the other reviewers say about location and ease of access to vaparetti stops is correct. This time I was struck by the off handedness of the man at reception. The feel of the building is one of tiredness in sore need of a radical makeover. The rooms were always small but the dingy paint makes them look tiny. The women looking after the rooms are fine and efficient. The breakfast is nothing to write home about and hardly in line with modern, northern European, notions of healthy eating. Anything more than the basic costs extra. The woman on breakfast duty was always charming and friendly. The dining restaurant in the evening is very expensive. The whole place is drab and should be avoided until it gets a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Maudey
Reviews.Content: Ah, it all looked so pretty in the photos, and lastminute rated it as a 4 star property......not true at all. From outside the Hotel is charming and pretty and in a fantastic and quiet location. Inside, it is very run down. Our bedroom was a great size with a lovely view over the bridge over the canal. We later recognised this location from the film The Comfort of Strangers starring Helen Mirren and Christopher Walken. However, the bed was incredibly uncomfortable. It was 2 beds pushed together and my husband would wake up in the night down the gap between the two. We complained and were told there are no double beds in the hotel at all. We slept very badly the whole time we were there, and even though it was December there were stil mozzies around- husband bitten in the room. The bathroom had a hand held shower- impossible to wash your hair without sitting in the bath! Worse still was the breakfast. Terrible stale bread, tired mortadella and sweaty cheese. Awful instant coffee too- not good. We had a wonderful holiday and spent most of our time outside of the hotel anyway. The location was perfect. We are going back to Venice at Easter but would not go to that hotel again- very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Vintage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Y_M_bambini
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel has an old feel to it, but with lots of charm, updated bathrooms, and great artwork everywhere. The San Marco location is the best, and we had a great time. The common areas are great with their fluffy red couches that make it really nice to become tranced in a good book after your feet are tired from wandering, uh getting lost in venice! We enjoyed the breakfast, although there were only a few options, the hot chocolate was soothing, the apricot croissants yummy, and we splurged & had one of the best cheese omlettes (5 Euro, well worth it!), had to get another one the next morning as well !! We would defintely stay here again, we liked the casualness of the place, great location, and the nice atmosphere. (The Hotel's resteraunt is VERY fancy & expensive) Defintely check out the Rialto bridge and the fresh fruit market and fish market during the morning/afternoons. The quality is outstanding, and we had the best tangerines & pears, and salads! On the rialto bridge one of the stores to look at, especially if you have kids, or need a child present, is ZORTOLUCCI, they make handmade & hand painted wooden clocks, music boxes, etc, it's like a gepetto store. The prices are very affordable for everything, because if you were to get these things in the states they would be at least ($40-$50), where most of the items are below 20 euros. Defintely visit the Palazzo Ducale twice. Once during the day (with the various vendors, and TONS of pigeons. People love the pigeons, and buy food and pose with them crawling all over them. Pigeons are pretty gross to me, but it's pretty amusing to see other people, all for a crazy photo!!) A night time visit is awesome when all the local artists come out, and you can grab an espresso or caldo chocolate (hot chocolate) de porta via (to go, in italian) and walk around. We met a local ventian artist who had the most amazing oils and watercolors. He doesn't show up til about 9:30pm, and in the winter wears a huge black down jacket, his name was Teriano so if you go there look for him, and see his beautiful work.

Reviews.Title: “Hany for the opera”
Reviews.Author: Freischutz
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Venice was primarily to attend a performance at the rebuilt opera house. It was the most beautiful opera house in the World and we grieved when it burnt down some 20 years ago. It has been rebuilt as an exact replica of what was there beforehand and is absolutely brilliant - well worth the visit. La Fenice et des Artistes is virtually next door and so could not be better located for our purpose. Hardly cheap (but what do you expect for Venice), but good when measured against the quality of similarly classed hotels in the town (we cannot compare it with the Danieli or Cipriani, having never stayed at that end of the market!). The buffet breakfast was a particularly good 'Eurobrek'. Not the hotel itself, but be wary of the restaurant just as you emerge into Piazza San Fantin from the hotel. The food was OK but the waiter endeavoured to pretend that the service charge added to the bill was not enough, we needed to give him a hefty tip as well. Needless to say we didn't...and left feeling as though we had been mugged.

Reviews.Title: “The negatives edge out the positives on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: scotd
Reviews.Content: PROS Central: It's bang in heart of San Marco, near San Marco sqaure, luxury shops, decent selection of tourist attractions and several boat bus stops. Calm: Relatively sheltered from street and canal noise (at least room 252, which has a garden view was). Female reception staff were helpful - very happy to reserve tickets for events, e.g. opera, and to recommend restaurants. Clean. Apart from mosquito 'splats' on the walls. Decor.Though not to everyone's taste, the rooms are quite fancy - think sillky, patterned wallpaper. Very baroque, old school and seems to attempt to keep with Venice's 'rennaisance' image. CONS Mosquitos are a definite problem and the hotel will not deal with them. Even in October, mozzies bit my partner and I about 25 times between us. Male reception staff: Particularly the chap who does the evening shift from 5pm onwards. He was unhelful, dishonest, unwilling to offer good service (see following comment) and quite agressive. Rooms - no soundproofing, air conditioning and quite small. Aircon isn't a problem in October - even in an above-average 20C - but I would advise against taking a room here in hot months, unless you're a sauna lover. There aren't fans either. In our room, you could here the conversation in the room 251 quite clearly and the television in 253. Not a problem for heavy sleepers or if you stay awake chatting from 12am - 2am too like our neighbours. However, both rooms were happy to reduce their noise upon request. Price: It's relative to the location, which is fairly expensive. We paid Â£400 for 3 nights. It's dependent on taste, but I'd recommend a cheaper district. Moving out from San Marco a little and you'll find better rooms and feel less like you're in a pure tourist zone and in more "real" Venice (despite there being a fairly tiny resident population). It won't take you long to swing down to the attractions of San Marco or anywhere else for that matter - it's a small city. Breakfast: If you have to leave before breakfast (pre-7.30am), the hotel will not arrange even for a bowl of cereal. A male receptionist actually lied by saying that breakfast was "complimentary" and not "factored into the room price" - so insisted that then hotel did not have to provide any breakfast for us at 6.30am or offer any financial compensation. Breakfast does not offer a wide selection but otherwise, if the times suit you, you won't starve. OVERALL, I wouldn't go back to this hotel, but if it was the only place in Venice and it wasn't a hot month, I'd agree to it.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Hotel la Fenice et des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: OldChap33
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent central location between Piazza San Marco and the Accademia bridge, next door to La Fenice Opera House, but is also in a quiet area. We paid 122 euros per night per double room, including breakfast, booking through the internet. The internet booking did not say breakfast was included, we asked at reception and they said it was. There were four of us, we occupied two double rooms. Both rooms were large and comfortable. Our bathroom was large, and newly fitted out, very nicely done. We never heard any noise from any other room. The air conditioning in both rooms worked well, given a few hours start, because of the large size of the rooms. Staff were OK. The breakfast was adequate but not exciting eg the fruit was tinned fruit salad. Plenty of reasonable restaurants around, but suggest you avoid eating at Hosteria Galileo in the corner of Campo San Anzolo a hundred yards away, the verbal "special of the day" fish dishes (similar to those on the menu at 14 euros) were charged on our bill at 35 euros each! - similarly their starters and the wine the waiter recommended - check the price of everything not on the menu very carefully if you eat there. Anyway la Fenice is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Easily found (get a decent map) and perfectly located for everything. All staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was warm and clean. The sheets and towels were changed daily and even the window shutters were closed for us before we arrived back in the evening. Breakfast was a typical continental one, but you could eat as much as you want. It's a good idea in Venice to have a big breakfast as food can be expensive and un-exceptional in many restaurants. Try eating at an osteria and choose from the selection of cicheti washed down with a few ombri. Prices are reasonable and the quality good. We found the restaurants very expensive and the food usually unimaginative and ordinary. But Venice is great especially if you get away from the tourist traps and explore the back lanes where there are some real treasures. Everywhere is walkable in very little time. Remember in February the weather is cold so wrap up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dusty9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 30th birthday in September and found the hotel to be very pretty in a very good central location within walking distance of everything!! Lots of fantastic restaurants close by and all the sights of Venice & St Marks sqr. Not too far to lug the heavy bags bearing in mind that most hotels in Venice require some walking to them!! We found the courtyard garden very pretty for breakfast and nice helpful staff. The room wasnt huge & came with unique Venetian decor but we werent too bothered by that and the bathroom was excellent with fantastic power shower!! I would stay here again. & Venice is a must see!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the location of the hotel was OK, i.e. close to St Mark's square, the standard of the rooms was very poor. We had 3 rooms in our party - one double turned out to be a 2 bedroomed appartment in a separate building with questionable decor, but overall not too bad, though the extractor fans in the bathrooms did not work - the second double was in the basement and smelt strongly of mould as soon as you walked in, due to the large mouldy damp patch on the bedroom ceiling which was clearly a plumbing leak from the room above. Being at street level, it was also very noisy from people standing smoking and talking right outside the window - the single room wasn't much bigger than a cupboard and the air conditioning didn't work, making it extremely hot and stuffy after having a shower. This was not a cheap hotel, which makes the value for money pretty bad, especially for the single room.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Fenice et des Artistes
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1936, 30124 Venice, Italy
